name: ~ALT
description: Whether the Alt key was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~CTRL
description: Whether the Control key was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~KEY_<name>
description: Whether the specified key was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~LMOUSE
description: Whether the left mouse button was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~MIDDLEMOUSE
description: Whether the middle mouse button was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~RMOUSE
description: Whether the right mouse button was pressed at the start of the script

name: ~SHIFT
description: Whether the Shift key was pressed at the start of the script
Terminates the current macro and dumps all content into the chat window for you to edit.
Asks for text input and includes it into the macro.

name: $$[[array,of,things]]
description: Opens a list populated with the specified items and includes the selected one.
example:
// Opens a list with the items Hello, Hi and Hey
$$[[Hello,Hi,Hey]]

name: $$[name]
description: Similar to $$? in that it asks for an input, but shows the specified name in front of the input box.

name: $$<file.txt>
description:
Includes the content of the file directly into the current macro.

One macro can only contain up to ten includes, everyone after that gets ignored.
In case you need a higher limit you have the ability to increase it from the config file.
The config file is in `.minecraft/liteconfig/common/macros/.macros.txt`. There you have to change the compiler.maxinclude property.
Provides up to ten different configurable lists, where you can add whatever text you want.

name: $$d
description: Only returns the metadata of the selected item.

name: $$f
description: Opens a prompt where you can add friends. Returns the selected friends name.

name: $$h
description: Opens a list of homes. They can be automatically queried from the server.

name: $$i
description: Only returns the item name without the metadata.

name: $$i:d
description: Opens a list of items and blocks and returns the whole item id with metadata included.

name: $$k
description: Presents you a list with all available resource packs.

name: $$m
description: Opens a prompt with all script files inside the `.minecraft/liteconfig/common/.macros` folder and includes the selected file so that it can be executed.

name: $$p
description:
Opens a list of all saved places.

Returns the coordinates of the selected place in the format `<x> <y> <z>`.

name: $$pn
description: Returns the name of the selected place.

name: $$px
description: Returns only the x coordinate of the selected place.

name: $$py
description: Returns only the y coordinate of the selected place.

name: $$pz
description: Returns only the z coordinate of the selected place.

name: $$s
description:
Opens a list of all available shaders.

Should be used with the SHADERGROUP() Action.
example:
// Changes to the selected shader
SHADERGROUP($$s)

name: $$t
description: Opens a list of towns on your server. They can be automatically queried from the server.

name: $$u
description: Opens a list of all current users on your server.

name: $$w
description: Opens a list of warps. They can be automatically queried from the server.

name: ACHIEVEMENTGET
description:
Displays an "Advancement made!" popup you get when completing an advancement with a custom message and optionally a custom item.

The successor is [TOAST](/docs/actions/toast) with the option to create other types of popups.

name: ALT
description: Whether the Alt key is pressed

name: AMBIENTVOLUME
description: Volume level for Ambient/Environment

name: ARMOUR
description: Armour points (each icon equals 2 points)

name: ARRAYSIZE
description:
Stores the size of the specified `<array[]>` in `[#outvar]`.

Returns the size of the array.
example:
&array[] = "Hello"
&array[] = "World"

ARRAYSIZE(&array[],#variant1)

&array[] = "Bigger"

#variant2 = ARRAYSIZE(&array[])

// Output 2 and 3 respectively
LOG(%#variant1%)
LOG(%#variant2%)

name: ASSIGN
description: Internal function

name: ATTACKPOWER
description: Attack power

name: ATTACKSPEED
description: Attack speed

name: BEGIN
description: Enters multi-line mode, allows entry of a script over multiple lines terminated by END

name: BIND
description: Set the specified key binding to the specified key code

name: BINDGUI
description: Binds the specified custom screen to the slot specified

name: BIOME
description:
Biome the Player is currently in.

Can be one of the following values:
* `Ocean`
* `Plains`
* `Desert`
* `Extreme Hills`
* `Forest`
* `Taiga`
* `Swampland`
* `River`
* `Hell`
* `Sky`
* `Frozen Ocean`
* `Frozen River`
* `Ice Plains`
* `Ice Mountains`
* `Mushroom Island`
* `Mushroom Island Shore`
* `Beach`
* `Desert Hills`
* `Forest Hills`
* `Taiga Hills`
* `Extreme Hills Edge`
* `Jungle`
* `Jungle Hills `

name: BLOCKVOLUME
description: Volume level for Blocks

name: BOOTSDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the Players boots

name: BOOTSDURABILITY
description: Durability of the Players boots

name: BOOTSID
description: ID of the Players boots

name: BOOTSNAME
description: Displayname of the Players boots

name: BREAK
description:
Interrupts exection of the innermost loop.

Can be used with:
* `DO;LOOP`
* `DO;UNTIL`
* `DO;WHILE`
* `FOR;NEXT`
* `FOREACH;NEXT`

name: CALCYAWTO
description:
Calculates the absolute yaw angle and optionally the distance to the specified coordinates.

Returns the calculated yaw value.
example:
CALCYAWTO(0,0,#variant1,#distance)
#variant2 = CALCYAWTO(0,0,,#distance)

// If you want to use this yaw value you have to add 180, because of legacy reasons
INC(#variant1,180)
LOOK(%#variant1%)

LOG(%#distance%)

name: CAMERA
description:
Set the current camera mode, call with no arguments to toggle modes

Can be one of the following values:

 * `0` for first person view
 * `1` for third person view, from behind
 * `2` for third person view, from the front

name: CAMERA
description: Current camera mode

name: CANFLY
description: Whether the Player can fly

name: CARDINALYAW
description: Yaw of the player relative to north (YAW + 180)

name: CAT
description: Lists the contents of the specified file into the console window

name: CHAT
description: Chat message with control codes

name: CHATCLEAN
description: Chat message without control codes

name: CHATFILTER
description: Enable or disable the chat filter

name: CHATHEIGHT
description:
Set height of the Minecraft chat whilst ingame.

`<value>` has to be between `20` and `180`.

name: CHATHEIGHTFOCUSED
description:
Set height of the Minecraft chat whilst in the chat GUI.

`<value>` has to be between `20` and `180`.

name: CHATMESSAGE
description: The message part of an incoming chat line. Just a guess, could be wrong.

name: CHATOPACITY
description:
Set opacity of the Minecraft chat.

`<value>` has to be between `10` and `100`.

name: CHATPLAYER
description: The player who send a chat line. Just a guess, could be wrong.

name: CHATSCALE
description:
Set scale of the Minecraft chat.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `100`.

name: CHATVISIBLE
description:
Set visibility of minecraft chat.

By default it toggles between Shown and Hidden.

Can be one of the following values:
* `"show"` or `0` for __Shown__
* `"commands"` or `1` for __Commands Only__
* `"hidden"` or `2` for __Hiddenn__

Returns the new visibility state.

name: CHATWIDTH
description:
Set width of the Minecraft chat.

`<value>` has to be between `40` and `320`.

name: CHESTPLATEDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the Players chestplate

name: CHESTPLATEDURABILITY
description: Durability of the Players chestplate

name: CHESTPLATEID
description: ID of the Players chestplate

name: CHESTPLATENAME
description: Displayname of the Players chestplate

name: CHUNKUPDATES
description: Amount of chunk updates

name: CLEARCHAT
description: Clears all messages from the chat window

name: CLEARCRAFTING
description: Cancels any queued crafting jobs

name: CLS
description: Clears the console display

name: CONFIG
description: Switch to the specified configuration

name: CONFIG
description: Loaded config

name: CONTAINERSLOTS
description: Amount of slots in opened container

name: CONTROLID
description: Internal id of the current control.

name: CONTROLNAME
description: The name set in the control under *Control Name*.

name: controls
description:
Iterates over existing controls.

Can be filtered either by the layout or by the type of the control.

name: CONTROLTYPE
description:
Type of the current control.

Can be one of the following values:
* `BUTTON`
* `ICON`
* `LABEL`
* `LAYOUT` (Custom Gui)
* `PLAYBACKSTATUS`
* `PROGRESSBAR`
* `SLIDER`
* `TEXTAREA`

name: COOLDOWN
description: Cooldown

name: CRAFT
description: Queues an auto-crafting request

name: CRAFTANDWAIT
description: Queues an auto-crafting request and waits for it to complete

name: CTRL
description: Whether the Control key is pressed

name: DATE
description: Current date in the format "year-month-day"
example:
// %DATE% is the same as
TIME(&date,"yy-MM-dd")

name: DATETIME
description: Current date and time in the format "year-month-day hour:minute:second"
example:
// %DATETIME% is the same as
TIME(&datetime,"yy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss")

name: DAY
description: Number of day

name: DAYTICKS
description: TICKS value modulo 24000 and shifted back 6000 so that 0 aligns with midnight

name: DAYTIME
description: Ingame time in the format hh:mm

name: DEC
description: Decrements the specified counter by 1 or by the specified amount
example:
#number = 5

DEC(#number)
// Ouputs 4
LOG(%#number%)

DEC(#number,3)
// Outputs 1
LOG(%#number%)

name: DECODE
description:
Converts an string from base64 back to an normal string.

Returns the decoded string.
example:
&string = "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="

DECODE(%&string%,&variant1)
&variant2 = DECODE(%&string%)

// Both output "Hello World"
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: DIFFICULTY
description: Difficulty of the world

name: DIMENSION
description:
Dimension the Player is in.

Can be one of the following values:
* `NETHER`
* `SURFACE`
* `END`
* `UNKNOWN`

name: DIRECTION
description:
Direction the Player is looking at, shortened to the first character.

Can be one of the following values:
* `N`
* `E`
* `S`
* `W`

name: DISCONNECT
description: Disconnects from the current game or server

name: DISPLAYHEIGHT
description: Height of the minecraft window

name: DISPLAYNAME
description: Player's displayname

name: DISPLAYWIDTH
description: Width of the minecraft window

name: DO
description:
Begins a loop.

When used together with `LOOP` you can specify an amount of loops. When not specified it will loop forever.

Can also be used together with `WHILE` or `UNTIL`.

name: DURABILITY
description: Durability of the equipped item

name: ECHO
description: Sends the specified message to the server

name: EDIT
description: Opens an editor for the specified file

name: EFFECT
description: Internal string id of the effect.

name: EFFECTID
description: Internal numeric id of the effect.

name: EFFECTNAME
description: Display name of the effect.

name: EFFECTPOWER
description: Power of the effect.

name: effects
description: Iterates over currently applied effects

name: EFFECTTIME
description: Remaining time of the effect in seconds.

name: ELSE
description:
The actions following this action will only be executed if no if-clause before evaluated to `true`.

Can be used with:
* `IF`
* `IFBEGINSWITH`
* `IFCONTAINS`
* `IFENDSWITH`
* `IFMATCHES`
* `ELSEIF`

name: ELSEIF
description:
The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<condition>` evaluates to `true` and no if-clause before evaluated to true.

Can be used with:

* `IF`
* `IFBEGINSWITH`
* `IFCONTAINS`
* `IFENDSWITH`
* `IFMATCHES`

name: ENCHANTMENT
description: Display name of the enchantment

name: ENCHANTMENTNAME
description: Only the name of the enchantment.

name: ENCHANTMENTPOWER
description: Power of the enchantment.

name: enchantments
description: Iterates over all enchantments on the equipped item

name: ENCODE
description:
Converts an string to base 64.

Returns the encoded value.
example:
&string = "Hello World"

ENCODE(%&string%,&variant1)
&variant2 = ENCODE(%&string%)

// Both output "SGVsbG8gV29ybGQ="
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: END
description: Ends a multi-line script and executes the contents of the buffer

name: ENDIF
description: Ends an if-clause.

name: ENDUNSAFE
description: Ends an active UNSAFE block

name: env
description: Iterates over all available variables
example:
// Outputs the name together with the value
foreach(env)
    log("%VARNAME%: %%VARNAME%%")
next

name: EXEC
description:
Creates a task by running the specified script file.

The params will be provided to the script as either variables (`&var1`, `&var2`, `&var3`, ...) or parameters (`$$[1]`, `$$[2]`, `$$[3]`, ...).

name: EXIT
description: Close the console window

name: FILTER
description: Indicate that this chat meesage should be filtered and terminate

name: FLYING
description: Whether the Player is flying

name: FOG
description:
Toggles render distance, or optionally specify render distance

Can be one of the following values:

 * `"far"` for 16 chunks
 * `"normal"` for 8 chunks
 * `"short"` for 4 chunks
 * `"tiny"` for 2 chunks

Alternatively the amount of chunks (up to 16) can also be specified directly

name: FOR
description:
Begins a for loop using the specified var as a loop counter.
Needs to be closed with `NEXT`.

The loop can be stopped early by using `BREAK`.

Alternative syntax:
```
FOR(<#var> = <start> to <end>)
FOR(<#var> = <start> to <end> step <step>)
```

name: FOREACH
description:
Runs a loop over the specified iterator.
Needs to be closed with `NEXT`.

The iterator can either be [one of the these](/docs/iterators/) or an array.

The loop can be stopped early by using `BREAK`.

Alternative Syntax:
```
FOREACH(<&array[]>,<&content>,[#index])
FOREACH(<&array[]> as <&content>)
FOREACH(<&array[]> as <#index> => <&content>)
```

name: FOV
description:
Sets the FOV angle in degrees, specifying time causes the value to change smoothly.

`<value>` has to be between `70` and `110`.

name: FOV
description: Field of View

name: FPS
description: Frames per Second

name: GAMEMODE
description:
Gamemode of the player as a string.

Can be one of the following values:
* `SURVIVAL`
* `CREATIVE`
* `ADVENTURE`
* `SPECTATOR`

name: GAMMA
description:
Sets the brightness value (percent), specifying time causes the value to change smoothly.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `200`.

name: GAMMA
description: Brightness level

name: GETID
description:
Gets the ID and optionally the data value of the block at the specified coordinates in the world.

Returns the name of the block.
example:
GETID(0,32,0,&variant1)
&variant2 = GETID(0,32,0,,#data)

name: GETIDREL
description:
Gets the ID and optionally the data value of the block at the specified coordinates relative to the player.

Returns the name of the block.

name: GETITEMINFO
description:
Gets the name and other info for the specified item id

Returns the item name

name: GETPROPERTY
description:
Returns the value of the specified property from the specified GUI control


The following properties are available for each control:

 * __Button__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"hotkey"`
    * `"text"`
    * `"hide"`
    * `"sticky"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Icon__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"align"`
    * `"scale"`
    * `"damage"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Label__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"align"`
    * `"text"`
    * `"binding"`
    * `"shadow"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Custom Gui__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"layout"`
    * `"width"`
    * `"heigth"`
 * __Playback Status__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
 * __Progress Bar__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"expression"`
    * `"style"`
    * `"min"`
    * `"max"`
    * `"calcmin"`
    * `"calcmax"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Slider__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"binding"`
    * `"hotkeydec"`
    * `"hotkeyinc"`
    * `"min"`
    * `"max"`
    * `"calcmin"`
    * `"calcmax"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Textarea__
    * `"name"`
    * `"visible"`
    * `"lifespan"`
    * `"colour"`

name: GETSLOT
description:
Gets the id of the slot containing an item matching the specified item id

Returns the slot number

name: GETSLOTITEM
description:
Gets information about the item in the specified slot

Returns the item name

name: GUI
description:
Opens the specified gui screen.
If no `[name]` is specified it will close the currently open gui.

Possible values:
* `"chat"`
* `"filterablechat"`
* `"menu"`
* `"inventory"`
* `"options"`
* `"video"`
* `"controls"`
* `"macrobind"`
* `"macroplayback"`
* `"macroconfig"`
* `"texteditor"`
* `"repl"`

name: GUI
description:
Name of the currently open GUI.

Can be one of the following values:
* `UNKNOWN`
* `GUISTATS`
* `GUISCREENADVANCEMENTS`
* `GUICHAT`
* `GUICOMMANDBLOCK`
* `GUICONFIRMOPENLINK`
* `GUICONTROLS`
* `GUICREATEFLATWORLD`
* `GUICREATEWORLD`
* `GUICUSTOMIZESKIN`
* `GUICUSTOMIZEWORLDSCREEN`
* `GUIDISCONNECTED`
* `GUIDOWNLOADTERRAIN`
* `GUIENCHANTMENT`
* `GUIERRORSCREEN`
* `GUIFLATPRESETS`
* `GUIGAMEOVER`
* `GUIHOPPER`
* `GUIINGAMEMENU`
* `GUILANGUAGE`
* `GUIMAINMENU`
* `GUIMEMORYERRORSCREEN`
* `GUIMERCHANT`
* `GUIMULTIPLAYER`
* `GUIOPTIONS`
* `GUIREPAIR`
* `GUISCREENADDSERVER`
* `GUISCREENBOOK`
* `GUISCREENCUSTOMIZEPRESETS`
* `GUISCREENDEMO`
* `GUISCREENOPTIONSSOUNDS`
* `GUISCREENREALMSPROXY`
* `GUISCREENRESOURCEPACKS`
* `GUISCREENSERVERLIST`
* `GUISCREENWORKING`
* `GUISHARETOLAN`
* `GUISLEEPMP`
* `GUISNOOPER`
* `GUIVIDEOSETTINGS`
* `GUIWINGAME`
* `GUIWORLDEDIT`
* `GUIWORLDSELECTION`
* `GUIYESNO`
* `GUIBEACON`
* `GUIBREWINGSTAND`
* `GUICHEST`
* `GUICONTAINERCREATIVE`
* `GUICRAFTING`
* `GUIDISPENSER`
* `GUIEDITCOMMANDBLOCKMINECART`
* `GUIEDITSIGN`
* `GUIEDITSTRUCTURE`
* `GUIFURNACE`
* `GUIINVENTORY`
* `GUISCREENHORSEINVENTORY`
* `GUISHULKERBOX`
* `SCREENCHATOPTIONS`
* `GUICONNECTING`

name: HEALTH
description: Health points (each icon equals 2 points)

name: HELMDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the Players helm

name: HELMDURABILITY
description: Durability of the Players helm

name: HELMID
description: ID of the Players helm

name: HELMNAME
description: Displayname of the Players helm

name: HELP
description: Displays help on the specified console command

name: HIT
description:
Type of the thing the Player is looking at

Can be one of the following values:

* `TILE`
* `PLAYER`
* `ENTITY`
* `NONE`

name: HIT_<name>
description: Value of the specified property of the block the Player is looking at

name: HITDATA
description: Metadata of the thing the Player is looking at

name: HITID
description: ID of the thing the Player is looking at

name: HITNAME
description: Displayname of the thing the Player is looking at

name: HITPROGRESS
description: Block breaking progress of the block the Player is looking at

name: HITSIDE
description:
Block side of the block the Player is looking at.


Can be one of the following values:

* `N`
* `E`
* `S`
* `W`
* `T`
* `B`
* `?`

name: HITUUID
description: UUID of the looked at entity or player

name: HITX
description: X position of the block the Player is looking at

name: HITY
description: Y position of the block the Player is looking at

name: HITZ
description: Z position of the block the Player is looking at

name: HOSTILEVOLUME
description: Volume level for Hostile Creatures

name: HUNGER
description: Hunger points (each icon equals 2 points)

name: IF
description:
The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<condition>` evaluates to `true`.

Needs to be closed with an `ENDIF`.

name: IFBEGINSWITH
description: The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<haystack>` starts with `<needle>`.

name: IFCONTAINS
description: The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<haystack>` contains the `<needle>`.

name: IFENDSWITH
description: The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<haystack>` ends with `<needle>`.

name: IFMATCHES
description:
The actions following this action will only be executed when the `<subject>` matches the `<pattern>`.

Optionally the whole match (or only a group specified by `[group]`) can be saved into `[&target]`.

name: IIF
description:
Inline IF statement.

Sends `<truetext>` as a chat message if condition succeeds, or sends `<falsetext>` if not.

name: IMPORT
description: Overlay the specified configuration

name: INC
description: Increments the specified counter by 1 or by the specified amount
example:
#number = 1

INC(#number)
// Ouputs 2
LOG(%#number%)

INC(#number,3)
// Outputs 5
LOG(%#number%)

name: INDEXOF
description:
Gets the first index of `<searchfor>` in `<array[]>` and stores it in `<#outvar>`.

`[casesensitiv]` can be set to `true` which will cause the check to be case-sensitiv. (By default the search is case-insensitiv.)

Returns the found index.
example:
&array[] = "Looking"
&array[] = "for"
&array[] = "Hello"
&array[] = "World"

INDEXOF(&array[],#variant1,"Hello")
#variant2 = INDEXOF(&array[],,"Not here")

// Output 2 and -1 respectively
LOG(%#variant1%)
LOG(%#variant2%)

name: INVENTORYDOWN
description: Scrolls the specified number of slots down through the hotbar

name: INVENTORYUP
description: Scrolls the specified number of slots up through the hotbar

name: INVSLOT
description: Selected inventory slot

name: ISRUNNING
description: Returns whether the specified macro is currently running

name: ITEM
description: ID of the equipped item

name: ITEMCODE
description: Internal code for the equipped item

name: ITEMDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the equipped item

name: ITEMID
description: Gets the legacy (numeric) ID for the specified item

name: ITEMIDDMG
description: ID and durability seperated by a colon of the equipped item

name: ITEMNAME
description: Displayname for the equipped item

name: ITEMNAME
description: Get the item descriptor for a legacy (numeric) item ID

name: ITEMUSEPCT
description: Previous value as percent of total useage time.

name: ITEMUSETICKS
description: All usable items increase this value once per tick.

name: JOIN
description:
Combines all values inside `<array[]>` with `<glue>` and stores it optionally in `[&output]`.

Returns the output.
example:
&array[] = "Join"
&array[] = "Hello"
&array[] = "World"

JOIN("--",&array[],&variant1)
&variant2 = JOIN(", ",&array[])

// Outputs "Join--Hello--World"
LOG(%&variant1%)

// Outputs "Join, Hello, World"
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: JOINEDPLAYER
description: Player name of the newly joined player.

name: KEY
description:
Activates the specified key binding for 1 tick

Can be one of the following values:
 * `"inventory"`
 * `"drop"`
 * `"chat"`
 * `"attack"`
 * `"use"`
 * `"pick"`
 * `"screenshot"`
 * `"smoothcamera"`
 * `"swaphands"`

name: KEY_<name>
description: Whether the key with the specified LWJGL keyname is pressed

name: KEYDOWN
description:
Sets the specified key binding state to pressed, only works with pressable bindings

Can be one of the following values:

 * `"forward"`
 * `"back"`
 * `"left"`
 * `"right"`
 * `"jump"`
 * `"sneak"`
 * `"playerlist"`
 * `"sprint"`

Can also be a key code value between 0 and 255

name: KEYID
description: Key ID of the key that started this script

name: KEYNAME
description: Keyname of the key that started this script

name: KEYUP
description:
Sets the specified key binding state to unpressed, only works with pressable bindings

Can be one of the following values:

 * `"forward"`
 * `"back"`
 * `"left"`
 * `"right"`
 * `"jump"`
 * `"sneak"`
 * `"playerlist"`
 * `"sprint"`

Can also be a key code value between 0 and 255

name: KILL
description: Terminate a running macro by ID, use TASKS to list available tasks

name: LCASE
description:
Converts the input string to lower case and stores it in output.

Returns the output.
example:
&string = "HeLLo wORLd"

LCASE(%&string%,&variant1)
&variant2 = LCASE(%&string%)

// Both output "hello world"
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: LEGGINGSDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the Players leggings

name: LEGGINGSDURABILITY
description: Durability of the Players leggings

name: LEGGINGSID
description: ID of the Players leggings

name: LEGGINGSNAME
description: Displayname of the Players leggings

name: LEVEL
description: XP level

name: LIGHT
description: Light level at current location

name: LIST
description: List available macro files in the macros directory

name: LIVE
description: Enables or disables "live mode". When live mode is enabled, commands will be sent to the server as chat messages and received chat will display in the console. When live mode is disabled (default) the REPL acts as a sandbox and chat messages are only displayed in the local console.

name: LMOUSE
description: Whether the left mouse button is pressed

name: LOCALDIFFICULTY
description: Local difficulty of the world

name: LOG
description: Shows the specified text only on the client-side in the chat window.

name: LOGRAW
description: Similar to minecraft tellraw command, parses and outputs JSON chat into the client-side chat window.

name: LOGTO
description: Outputs the specified text into the specified target, target can be a text file name or the name of a textarea

name: LOOK
description:
Faces the player in the specified direction, prefix angles with + or - for relative moves

`<yaw>` can also be one of the following values:

 * `"north"`
 * `"east"`
 * `"south"`
 * `"west"`
 * `"near"`

The `[time]` is parsed as a float value and then used as seconds.

name: LOOKS
description:
Smoothly turnes the player to the specified direction, prefix angles with + or - for relative moves

`<yaw>` can also be one of the following values:

 * `"north"`
 * `"east"`
 * `"south"`
 * `"west"`
 * `"near"`


The `[time]` is parsed as a float value and then used as seconds.

name: LOOP
description: Ends a loop that was started with DO

name: MACROID
description: Internal id of the macro.
example:
FOREACH(running)
    LOG("[%MACROID%] %MACRONAME% running for %MACROTIME% seconds")
NEXT

name: MACRONAME
description: Display name of the macro.
example:
FOREACH(running)
    LOG("[%MACROID%] %MACRONAME% running for %MACROTIME% seconds")
NEXT

name: MACROTIME
description: The time the macro is already running in seconds.
example:
FOREACH(running)
    LOG("[%MACROID%] %MACRONAME% running for %MACROTIME% seconds")
NEXT

name: MAINHANDCOOLDOWN
description: MAINHANDCOOLDOWN

name: MAINHANDDURABILITY
description: MAINHANDDURABILITY

name: MAINHANDITEM
description: MAINHANDITEM

name: MAINHANDITEMCODE
description: MAINHANDITEMCODE

name: MAINHANDITEMDAMAGE
description: MAINHANDITEMDAMAGE

name: MAINHANDITEMIDDMG
description: MAINHANDITEMIDDMG

name: MAINHANDITEMNAME
description: MAINHANDITEMNAME

name: MAINHANDSTACKSIZE
description: MAINHANDSTACKSIZE

name: MATCH
description:
Runs a regular expression match on the `<subject>` and puts the result in `<&target>`.

Returns the matched groups as an array.

Alternative Syntax;
```
MATCH(<subject>,<pattern>,{&target1,&target2,&target3})
MATCH(<subject>,<pattern>,&target[])
```

name: MAXPLAYERS
description: Amount of players the server can hold

name: MIDDLEMOUSE
description: Whether the middle mouse button is pressed

name: MODE
description:
Gamemode of the player as a number.

Can be one of the following values:
* `0` for Survival
* `1` for Creative
* `2` for Adventure
* `3` for Spectator

name: MODIFY
description: Set new content for this chat message

name: MUSIC
description: Volume level for Music

name: MUSIC
description:
Sets the music volume, specifying time causes the value to change smoothly.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `100`.

name: NEUTRALVOLUME
description: Volume level for Friendly Creatures

name: NEXT
description: Completes a for or foreach loop

name: OFFHANDCOOLDOWN
description: Offhand cooldown

name: OFFHANDDURABILITY
description: Durability of the offhand item

name: OFFHANDITEM
description: ID of the offhand item

name: OFFHANDITEMCODE
description: Internal code for the offhand item

name: OFFHANDITEMDAMAGE
description: Maximum uses of the offhand item

name: OFFHANDITEMIDDMG
description: ID and durability seperated by a colon of the offhand item

name: OFFHANDITEMNAME
description: Displayname for the offhand item

name: OFFHANDSTACKSIZE
description: Stacksize of the offhand item

name: OLDINVSLOT
description: Selected inventory slot before it was changed

name: onArmourChange
description:
Raised whenever your armour level changes, for example when you take damage or put on a new piece of armour
Each armour icon represents 2 armour points so the maximum armour level is 20

name: onArmourDurabilityChange
description:
Raised when any currently-worn armour durability level changes
Different items have different durability amounts nd change durability at different times

name: onAutoCraftingComplete
description: Raised when an auto-crafting process is completed

name: onChat
description: Raised whenever a new chat message arrives from the server

name: onConfigChange
description:
Raised when the active configuration is changed
Note that this event will be raised in the new config not the old one!

name: onFilterableChat
description: Raised whenever a new chat message is sent

name: onFoodChange
description:
Raised whenever your food bar level changes
Each food icon represents 2 food points so the maximum food level is 20

name: onHealthChange
description:
Raised whenever your health level changes eg. when you take damage or receive health from food or potions
Each heart represents 2 health points so the maximum health is 20

name: onInventorySlotChange
description: Raised when the selected inventory slot is changed

name: onItemDurabilityChange
description:
Raised when the currently-wielded item's durability level changes
Different items have different durability amounts and change durability at different times

name: onJoinGame
description: Raised whenever you join a game (single player or SMP) and can be used to start background macros or issue server commands when joining a new game

name: onLevelChange
description: Raised when your XP level changes

name: ONLINEPLAYERS
description: Amount of players currently on the server

name: onModeChange
description: Raised when your game mode changes, for example when switching from creative to survival

name: onOxygenChange
description:
Raised when your oxygen level changes
The oxygen level represents the number of ticks that you can breathe underwater before beginning to drown

name: onPickupItem
description: Raised when an item is picked up by the player

name: onPlayerJoined
description: Raised when a new player joins the server in a multiplayer game

name: onSendChatMessage
description: Raised whenever a new chat message is sent

name: onShowGui
description: Raised when the current Minecraft GUI changes

name: onWeatherChange
description: Raised when the current weather level changes

name: onWorldChange
description: Raised when the world changes, for example when travelling between worlds in multi-world servers or travelling between Surface, Nether and End

name: onXPChange
description: Raised when you gain (or lose) experience

name: OXYGEN
description: Air Level (from 0 to 300)

name: PASS
description: Indicate that this chat message should PASS the filter and terminate

name: PICK
description:
Selects the specified item id if it is on the hotbar, specify multiple items to pick in order of preference.

Returns the selected item name.

name: PICKUPAMOUNT
description: Amount of items picked up

name: PICKUPDATA
description: Metadata of the picked up item.

name: PICKUPID
description: Item id of the picked up item.

name: PICKUPITEM
description: Display name of the picked up item.

name: PITCH
description: Pitch of the player

name: PLACESIGN
description:
Places a sign in the world with the specified text (if you have one)

 - `[line1]` to `[line4]` specifies the content for each sign line
 - `[showgui]` should be `true` if you want to continue editing the text

name: PLAYER
description: Player's name

name: PLAYERNAME
description: The current player

name: players
description: Iterates over online players on your server

name: PLAYERVOLUME
description: Volume level for Players

name: PLAYSOUND
description:
Plays the specified sound.

If the `<sound>` starts with `"custom."` it looks inside an folder `sounds` inside the macros config folder.

`[volume]` has to be betweem `0` and `100`

name: POP
description:
Removes the last entry from the end of `<array[]>` and stores it in `<outvar>`.

Returns the popped element.
example:
&array[] = "Hello"
&array[] = "World"

POP(&array[],&string)

// Outputs "World"
LOG(%&string%)

name: POPUPMESSAGE
description:
Display a message in the area above the hotbar

The `<message>` can contain color codes.

If `[animate]` is set to true the message will animate through different colors

name: PRESS
description: Injects the specified key event directly into the keyboard buffer for 1 tick

name: PROMPT
description:
Displays a prompt (or prompts) by parsing the params in paramstring.

Returns the result.
example: PROMPT(&targetvar,"$$u","Prompt message",true);

name: properties
description: Iterates over the properties of the block you are looking at

name: PROPNAME
description:
The name of the current property.

Can be one of the following values:
* `AGE`
* `ATTACHED`
* `AXIS`
* `BITES`
* `CHECK_DECAY`
* `COLOR`
* `CONDITIONAL`
* `CONTENTS`
* `DAMAGE`
* `DECAYABLE`
* `DELAY`
* `DISARMED`
* `DOWN`
* `EAST`
* `ENABLED`
* `EXPLODE`
* `EXTENDED`
* `EYE`
* `FACING`
* `HALF`
* `HAS_BOTTLE_0`
* `HAS_BOTTLE_1`
* `HAS_BOTTLE_2`
* `HAS_RECORD`
* `HINGE`
* `IN_WALL`
* `LAYERS`
* `LEGACY_DATA`
* `LEVEL`
* `LOCKED`
* `MODE`
* `MOISTURE`
* `NODROP`
* `NORTH`
* `OCCUPIED`
* `OPEN`
* `PART`
* `POWER`
* `POWERED`
* `ROTATION`
* `SEAMLESS`
* `SHAPE`
* `SHORT`
* `SNOWY`
* `SOUTH`
* `STAGE`
* `TRIGGERED`
* `TYPE`
* `UP`
* `VARIANT`
* `WEST`
* `WET`

name: PROPVALUE
description: The value of the current property.

name: PUSH
description: Appends `<value>` to the end of `<array[]>`

name: PUT
description: Inserts `<value>` at the first empty point in `<array[]>`.
example:
&array[0] = "Hello"
&array[2] = "World"

// Adds an element at the first empty point in the array
PUT(&array[],"Inserted")

// Outputs "Hello", "Inserted" and "World"
FOREACH(&array[],&string)
    LOG(%&string%)
NEXT

name: RAIN
description: Rain level

name: RANDOM
description:
Assigns a random number between min and max to target.

Returns the value.

name: REASON
description:
The reason why the crafting was completed or aborted.

Can be one of the following values:

* `DONE`
* `CREATIVE`
* `NORECIPE`
* `NOTSTARTED`
* `TIMEOUT`
* `NOITEMS`
* `ERROR`
* `NOSPACE`

name: RECORDVOLUME
description: Volume level for Jukebox/Noteblocks

name: REGEXREPLACE
description:
Replace all matches of `<pattern>` with `[replace]` in `<&subject>`.

Returns the new string.

name: RELOADRESOURCES
description: Reloads resource packs, same as pressing F3 + T

name: REPL
description:
Access the REPL interface.

[Commands for the REPL have their own page](/docs/commands)

name: REPLACE
description:
Replace all occurrences of `<search>` with `[replace]` in `<&subject>`.

Returns the new string.

name: RESOURCEPACKS
description: Sets the resource pack stack to the order matching the specified patterns

name: RESOURCEPACKS[]
description: Array of selected resource packs

name: RESPAWN
description: Respawns the player if you are dead

name: RM
description: Removes (deletes) the specified file

name: RMOUSE
description: Whether the right mouse button is pressed

name: RUN
description: Runs the specified script synchronously. Args are provided to the target script in the same manner as EXEC (eg. params $$[1], $$[2].. etc)

name: running
description: Iterates over all currently running macros
example:
FOREACH(running)
    LOG("[%MACROID%] %MACRONAME% running for %MACROTIME% seconds")
NEXT

name: SATURATION
description: Saturation level (normally hidden from the Player)

name: SAY
description: Sends the specified message as chat, only sends remotely if "live mode" is enabled

name: SCREEN
description: Name of the current custom GUI

name: SCREENNAME
description: Display name of the current custom GUI

name: SEED
description: Seed of the world (only available in SP)

name: SENSITIVITY
description: Sensitivity

name: SENSITIVITY
description:
Sets the mouse sensitivity, specifying time causes the value to change smoothly.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `200`.

name: SERVER
description: IP of the server

name: SERVERMOTD
description: Motto of the day of the server

name: SERVERNAME
description: Name of the server

name: SET
description:
Sets the value of `<target>` to `[value]`.

Returns the value.

name: SETLABEL
description: Sets the text (and optionally binding) of the specified label

name: SETPROPERTY
description:
Sets the value of the specified property on the specified GUI control

The values set with this action are not saved until you edit the control manually.

The following properties are available for each control:

 * __Button__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"hotkey"`
    * `"text"`
    * `"hide"`
    * `"sticky"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Icon__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"align"`
    * `"scale"`
    * `"damage"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Label__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"align"`
    * `"text"`
    * `"binding"`
    * `"shadow"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Custom Gui__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"layout"`
    * `"width"`
    * `"heigth"`
 * __Playback Status__
    * `"visible"`
 * __Progress Bar__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"expression"`
    * `"style"`
    * `"min"`
    * `"max"`
    * `"calcmin"`
    * `"calcmax"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Slider__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"binding"`
    * `"hotkeydec"`
    * `"hotkeyinc"`
    * `"min"`
    * `"max"`
    * `"calcmin"`
    * `"calcmax"`
    * `"colour"`
    * `"background"`
 * __Textarea__
    * `"visible"`
    * `"lifespan"`
    * `"colour"`

name: SETRES
description:
Sets the size of the minecraft game window.

`<width>` has to be between `0` and `3840`.

`<height>` has to be between `0` and `2160`.

name: SETSLOTITEM
description: Creative mode only, set the contents of a hot bar slot

name: SHADERGROUP
description: Selected shader

name: SHADERGROUP
description:
Sets the active shader group to the shader matching path

Can be one of the following shaders:

* `"spider"`
* `"outline"`
* `"desaturate"`
* `"wobble"`
* `"scan_pincushion"`
* `"ntsc"`
* `"creeper"`
* `"color_convolve"`
* `"blur"`
* `"bits"`
* `"blobs2"`
* `"flip"`
* `"invert"`
* `"notch"`
* `"antialias"`
* `"entity_outline"`
* `"bumpy"`
* `"sobel"`
* `"art"`
* `"blobs"`
* `"fxaa"`
* `"pencil"`
* `"phosphor"`
* `"deconverge"`
* `"green"`

You can also use `"+"` or `"-"` to toggle between shaders.

Returns the name of the selected shader.

name: SHADERGROUPS[]
description: Array of available shaders

name: SHIFT
description: Whether the Shift key is pressed

name: SHOWGUI
description:
Show a custom gui screen, creates it if it doesn't exist.

Set `[macro_keys]` to `true` when macro keys should still work.

name: SHUTDOWN
description: Shut down the minecraft client

name: SIGNTEXT[]
description: Array of lines on a sign the Player is looking at

name: SLOT
description: Selects the specified slot on the hot bar

name: SLOTCLICK
description:
Simulates clicking on the specified slot in the current GUI

`<slot>` can be `-999` to drop the previously selected item.

`[button]` can be either `"left"` for left-click or `"right"` for right-click

`[shift]` should be `true` if you want to shift-click

name: SOUND
description: Master Volume level

name: SPLIT
description:
Splits the supplied `<source>` string on every `<delimiter>` into `<output[]>`.

Returns the output array.
example:
&string = "Split Hello World"

SPLIT(" ",%&string%,&variant1[])
&variant2[] = SPLIT("o",%&string%)

// Outputs "Split", "Hello" and "World"
FOREACH(&variant1[],&string)
    LOG(%&string%)
NEXT

// Outputs "Split Hell", " W" and "rld"
FOREACH(&variant2[],&string)
    LOG(%&string%)
NEXT

name: SPRINT
description: Sets the player state to sprinting if sufficient stamina (food)

name: SQRT
description:
Calculate the rounded square root of `<value>` and store it in `<#outvar>`.

Returns the result.
example:
SQRT(100,#variant1)
#variant2 = SQRT(-50)

// Outputs 10 and 0
LOG(%#variant1%)
LOG(%#variant2%)

name: STACKSIZE
description: Stack size of the equipped item

name: STOP
description:
Stops the current macro, or macros matching the specified ID

For stopping all macros you can use either `"all"` or `"*"`.

name: STORE
description:
Stores a value into one of the predefined parameter lists

Currently only `"place"` is allowed for `<type>`

Your current location will be saved into the `$$p` list

name: STOREOVER
description:
Stores a value into one of the predefined parameter lists and overwrites an entry if it already exists

Currently only `"place"` is allowed for `<type>`

Your current location will be saved into the `$$p` list

name: STRIP
description:
Strips all formatting codes from the specified `<text>` and assigns the result to `<&target>`.

Returns the result.
example:
&string = "eyellow rlbold"

STRIP(&variant1,%&string%)
&variant2 = STRIP(,%&string%)

// Both output "yellow bold"
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: TASKS
description: List currently executing tasks

name: TICKS
description: current world time value (which will be a static number if doDayNightCycle game rule is false)

name: TILEID
description: Gets the legacy (numeric) ID for the specified tile

name: TILENAME
description: Get the descriptor for a legacy (numeric) tile ID

name: TIME
description:
Stores the current time and date into &target, optionally using format specified.

Returns the formatted time string.

name: TIME
description: Current time in the format "hour:minute:second"
example:
// %TIME% is the same as
TIME(&time,"hh:mm:ss")

name: TIMESTAMP
description: UNIX Timestamp

name: TITLE
description: Displays the specified custom title, call with no arguments to hide current titles

name: TOAST
description:
Displays an user-defined toast.

The following toasts are possible:

 * __Advancement Toast__ ("Advancement made!")
   * `[type]` should be `"advancement"`
   * `[icon]` can be any item name
   * `[text1]` will be displayed
 * __Challenge Toast__ ("Challenge complete!")
   * `[type]` should be `"challenge"`
   * `[icon]` can be any item name
   * `[text1]` will be displayed
 * __Goal Toast__ ("Goal reached!")
   * `[type]` should be `"goal"`
   * `[icon]` can be any item name
   * `[text1]` will be displayed
 * __Recipe Toast__ ("New Recipes Unlocked!")
   * `[type]` should be `"recipe"`
   * `[icon]` can be any item name
   * No text will be displayed
 * __Tutorial Toast__
   * `[type]` should be `"tutorial"`
   * `[icon]` can be one of the following values
       * `"keys"`
       * `"mouse"`
       * `"tree"`
       * `"recipe_block"`
       * `"planks"`
   * `[text1]` and `[text2]` will be displayed
   * `[ticks]` specifies how long the toast will be displayed
 * __System Hint Toast__
   * `[type]` should be `"hint"`
   * `[icon]` should be empty
   * `[text1]` and `[text2]` will be displayed
 * __System Narrator Toast__
   * `[type]` should be `"narrator"`
   * `[icon]` should be empty
   * `[text1]` and `[text2]` will be displayed
 * __Remove user-defined tutorial toasts__
   * `[type]` should be `"clear"`
   * if `[icon]` is `"all"` vanilla toast will also be removed

name: TOGGLE
description: Toggles the specified boolean `[flag]` value

name: TOGGLEKEY
description:
Toggles the pressed state of the specified key binding, only works with pressable bindings

Can be one of the following values:

 * `"forward"`
 * `"back"`
 * `"left"`
 * `"right"`
 * `"jump"`
 * `"sneak"`
 * `"playerlist"`
 * `"sprint"`

Can also be a key code value between 0 and 255

name: TOTALTICKS
description: current total world time (which increases all the time regardless of the gamerule doDayNightCycle)

name: TOTALXP
description: Total amount of experience points

name: TRACE
description:
Performs a ray trace operation which sets the raytrace variables in the local scope. 

`<distance>` can be between `3` and `256`

`[entities]` can be true, if you want to include entities in your trace.

Returns the type of the result, which can be one of the following values:
* `TILE`
* `PLAYER`
* `ENTITY`
* `NONE`

name: TRACE_<name>
description: Value of the specified property of the executed TRACE()

name: TRACEDATA
description: Metadata of the block

name: TRACEID
description: The id

name: TRACENAME
description: The name

name: TRACESIDE
description:
Side of the block.

Can be one of the following values:

* `N`
* `E`
* `S`
* `W`
* `T`
* `B`
* `?`

name: TRACETYPE
description:
The type of the result.

Can be one of the following values:

* `TILE`
* `PLAYER`
* `ENTITY`
* `NONE`

name: TRACEUUID
description: Returns the UUID of other players.

name: TRACEX
description: X position

name: TRACEY
description: Y position

name: TRACEZ
description: Z position

name: TYPE
description: Injects the specified key sequence directly into the keyboard buffer at a rate of 1 key per tick

name: UCASE
description:
Converts the input string to upper case and stores it in output.

Returns the output.
example:
&string = "HeLLo wORLd"

UCASE(%&string%,&variant1)
&variant2 = UCASE(%&string%)

// Both output "HELLO WORLD"
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

name: UNIMPORT
description: Remove the specified configuration overlay if active

name: UNIQUEID
description: Returns a new UUID everytime it is accessed.

name: UNSAFE
description:
Begins an `UNSAFE` block with maximum executions set to `<executions>`.

`<executions>` has to be betweem `0` and `10000`. Default is `100`.

name: UNSET
description: Un-sets the specified `<flag>` variable.

name: UNSPRINT
description: Sets the player state to not sprinting

name: UNTIL
description: Completes a loop started with DO but exits the loop if `<condition>` is met.

name: UUID
description: UUID of the Player

name: VARNAME
description: Contains the variable name.
example:
// Outputs the name together with the value
foreach(env)
    log("%VARNAME%: %%VARNAME%%")
next

name: VEHICLE
description:
Vehicle type

Can be one of the following values:

* `Minecart`
* `Boat`
* `Horse`
* `Mule`
* `Skeleton Horse`
* `Zombie Horse`
* `Llama`
* `Pig`

name: VEHICLEHEALTH
description: Vehicle health

name: VERSION
description: Displays current version

name: VOLUME
description:
Sets the sound volume for the specified category.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `100`.

`[category]` can be one of the following values:
* `"music"`
* `"master"`
* `"records"`
* `"weather"`
* `"blocks"`
* `"hostile"`
* `"neutral"`
* `"players"`
* `"ambient"`

name: WAIT
description:
Pauses the script for the time (in seconds) specified, suffix `ms` for a wait in milliseconds or `t` to wait in ticks.

It is not possible to wait less than the duration of a tick (`~50ms`), because the mod checks each tick if it should continue.
example:
// Each wait one second
WAIT(20t)
WAIT(1)
WAIT(1000ms)

name: WALKTO
description: Was never offically in the mod.

name: WEATHERVOLUME
description: Volume level for Weather

name: WHILE
description: Completes a loop started with DO but exits the loop if `<condition>` is not met

name: WHOAMI
description: Displays current user name

name: XP
description: Current amount of experience points

name: XPOS
description: Position in X direction

name: XPOSF
description: The position in X direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.

name: YAW
description: Yaw of the player

name: YPOS
description: Position in Y direction

name: YPOSF
description: The position in Y direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.

name: ZPOS
description: Position in Z direction

name: ZPOSF
description: The position in Z direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.

clear"`
   * if `[icon]` is `"all"` vanilla toast will also be removed

changelog.name: TOGGLE
changelog.description: Toggles the specified boolean `[flag]` value

changelog.name: TOGGLEKEY
changelog.description:
Toggles the pressed state of the specified key binding, only works with pressable bindings

Can be one of the following values:

 * `"forward"`
 * `"back"`
 * `"left"`
 * `"right"`
 * `"jump"`
 * `"sneak"`
 * `"playerlist"`
 * `"sprint"`

Can also be a key code value between 0 and 255

changelog.name: TOTALTICKS
changelog.description: current total world time (which increases all the time regardless of the gamerule doDayNightCycle)

changelog.name: TOTALXP
changelog.description: Total amount of experience points

changelog.name: TRACE
changelog.description:
Performs a ray trace operation which sets the raytrace variables in the local scope. 

`<distance>` can be between `3` and `256`

`[entities]` can be true, if you want to include entities in your trace.

Returns the type of the result, which can be one of the following values:
* `TILE`
* `PLAYER`
* `ENTITY`
* `NONE`

changelog.name: TRACE_<name>
changelog.description: Value of the specified property of the executed TRACE()

changelog.name: TRACEDATA
changelog.description: Metadata of the block

changelog.name: TRACEID
changelog.description: The id

changelog.name: TRACENAME
changelog.description: The name

changelog.name: TRACESIDE
changelog.description:
Side of the block.

Can be one of the following values:

* `N`
* `E`
* `S`
* `W`
* `T`
* `B`
* `?`

changelog.name: TRACETYPE
changelog.description:
The type of the result.

Can be one of the following values:

* `TILE`
* `PLAYER`
* `ENTITY`
* `NONE`

changelog.name: TRACEUUID
changelog.description: Returns the UUID of other players.

changelog.name: TRACEX
changelog.description: X position

changelog.name: TRACEY
changelog.description: Y position

changelog.name: TRACEZ
changelog.description: Z position

changelog.name: TYPE
changelog.description: Injects the specified key sequence directly into the keyboard buffer at a rate of 1 key per tick

changelog.name: UCASE
changelog.description:
Converts the input string to upper case and stores it in output.

Returns the output.
changelog.example:
&string = "HeLLo wORLd"

UCASE(%&string%,&variant1)
&variant2 = UCASE(%&string%)

// Both output "HELLO WORLD"
LOG(%&variant1%)
LOG(%&variant2%)

changelog.name: UNIMPORT
changelog.description: Remove the specified configuration overlay if active

changelog.name: UNIQUEID
changelog.description: Returns a new UUID everytime it is accessed.

changelog.name: UNSAFE
changelog.description:
Begins an `UNSAFE` block with maximum executions set to `<executions>`.

`<executions>` has to be betweem `0` and `10000`. Default is `100`.

changelog.name: UNSET
changelog.description: Un-sets the specified `<flag>` variable.

changelog.name: UNSPRINT
changelog.description: Sets the player state to not sprinting

changelog.name: UNTIL
changelog.description: Completes a loop started with DO but exits the loop if `<condition>` is met.

changelog.name: UUID
changelog.description: UUID of the Player

changelog.name: VARNAME
changelog.description: Contains the variable name.
changelog.example:
// Outputs the name together with the value
foreach(env)
    log("%VARNAME%: %%VARNAME%%)
next

changelog.name: VEHICLE
changelog.description:
Vehicle type

Can be one of the following values:

* `Minecart`
* `Boat`
* `Horse`
* `Mule`
* `Skeleton Horse`
* `Zombie Horse`
* `Llama`
* `Pig`

changelog.name: VEHICLEHEALTH
changelog.description: Vehicle health

changelog.name: VERSION
changelog.description: Displays current version

changelog.name: VOLUME
changelog.description:
Sets the sound volume for the specified category.

`<value>` has to be between `0` and `100`.

`[category]` can be one of the following values:
* `"music"`
* `"master"`
* `"records"`
* `"weather"`
* `"blocks"`
* `"hostile"`
* `"neutral"`
* `"players"`
* `"ambient"`

changelog.name: WAIT
changelog.description: Pauses the script for the time (in seconds) specified, suffix `ms` for a wait in milliseconds or `t` to wait in ticks.

changelog.name: WALKTO
changelog.description: Was never offically in the mod.

changelog.name: WEATHERVOLUME
changelog.description: Volume level for Weather

changelog.name: WHILE
changelog.description: Completes a loop started with DO but exits the loop if `<condition>` is not met

changelog.name: WHOAMI
changelog.description: Displays current user name

changelog.name: XP
changelog.description: Current amount of experience points

changelog.name: XPOS
changelog.description: Position in X direction

changelog.name: XPOSF
changelog.description: The position in X direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.

changelog.name: YAW
changelog.description: Yaw of the player

changelog.name: YPOS
changelog.description: Position in Y direction

changelog.name: YPOSF
changelog.description: The position in Y direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.

changelog.name: ZPOS
changelog.description: Position in Z direction

changelog.name: ZPOSF
changelog.description: The position in Z direction with three decimal places after the comma as a string.
